availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Harriett M. Odor. Father of James Odor, Nancy J. Odor, Mary E. Odor, and Alexander Odor. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 127A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 395.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 486.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 110B-111A.
